front.div:
ABSTRACT: A summary is given of the multidisciplinary research efforts in the Netherlands in the field of polymer-based
photovoltaics (PV) between 1997 and 2005. It has been shown that different types of bulk heterojunctions namely
polymer:fullerene, polymer:polymer and polymer:metal-oxide cells can be made in a laboratory environment with relatively
simple and new low temperature deposition techniques using conjugated polymers as the primary absorber. State-of-the art
efficiencies have been achieved for all polymer based solar cell concepts.
